  16. (* The interactive toplevel loop *)

  18. open Format

  22. open Typedtree
  23. open Outcometree
  24. open Topcommon

  26. ‌let implementation_label = "native toplevel"

  28. ‌let global_symbol id =
  29.   let sym = Compilenv.symbol_for_global id in
  30.   match Tophooks.lookup sym with
  31.   | None ->
  32.     fatal_error ("Toploop.global_symbol " ^ (Ident.unique_name id))
  33.   | Some obj -> obj

  35. ‌let remembered = ref Ident.empty

  37. ‌let rec remember phrase_name i = function
  38.   | [] -> ()
  39.   | Sig_value  (id, _, _) :: rest
  40.   | Sig_module (id, _, _, _, _) :: rest
  41.   | Sig_typext (id, _, _, _) :: rest
  42.   | Sig_class  (id, _, _, _) :: rest ->
  43.       remembered := Ident.add id (phrase_name, i) !remembered;
  44.       remember phrase_name (succ i) rest
  45.   | _ :: rest -> remember phrase_name i rest

  47. ‌let toplevel_value id =
  48.   try Ident.find_same id !remembered
  49.   with _ -> Misc.fatal_error @@ "Unknown ident: " ^ Ident.unique_name id

  51. ‌let close_phrase lam =
  52.   let open Lambda in
  53.   Ident.Set.fold (fun id l ->
  54.     let glb, pos = toplevel_value id in
  55.     let glob =
  56.       Lprim (Pfield (pos, Pointer, Mutable),
  57.              [Lprim (Pgetglobal glb, [], Loc_unknown)],
  58.              Loc_unknown)
  59.     in
  60.     Llet(Strict, Pgenval, id, glob, l)
  61.   ) (free_variables lam) lam

  63. ‌let toplevel_value id =
  64.   let glob, pos =
  65.     if Config.flambda then toplevel_value id else Translmod.nat_toplevel_name id
  66.   in
  67.   (Obj.magic (global_symbol glob)).(pos)

  69. (* Return the value referred to by a path *)

  71. module EvalBase = struct

  73.   let eval_ident id =
  74.     try
  75.       if Ident.persistent id || Ident.global id
  76.       then global_symbol id
  77.       else toplevel_value id
  78.     with _ ->
  79.       raise (Undefined_global (Ident.name id))

  81. end

  83. include Topcommon.MakeEvalPrinter(EvalBase)

  85. (* Load in-core and execute a lambda term *)

  87. ‌let may_trace = ref false (* Global lock on tracing *)

  89. ‌let load_lambda ppf ~module_ident ~required_globals phrase_name lam size =
  90.   if !Clflags.dump_rawlambda then fprintf ppf "%a@." Printlambda.lambda lam;
  91.   let slam = Simplif.simplify_lambda lam in
  92.   if !Clflags.dump_lambda then fprintf ppf "%a@." Printlambda.lambda slam;

  94.   let program =
  95.     { Lambda.
  96.       code = slam;
  97.       main_module_block_size = size;
  98.       module_ident;
  99.       required_globals;
  100.     }
  101.   in
  102.   Tophooks.load ppf phrase_name program

  104. (* Print the outcome of an evaluation *)

  106. let pr_item =
  107.   Printtyp.print_items
  108.     (fun env -> function
  109.       | Sig_value(id, {val_kind = Val_reg; val_type}, _) ->
  110.           Some (outval_of_value env (toplevel_value id) val_type)
  111.       | _ -> None
  112.     )

  114. (* Execute a toplevel phrase *)

  116. let phrase_seqid = ref 0

  118. let name_expression ~loc ~attrs exp =
  119.   let name = "_$" in
  120.   let id = Ident.create_local name in
  121.   let vd =
  122.     { val_type = exp.exp_type;
  123.       val_kind = Val_reg;
  124.       val_loc = loc;
  125.       val_attributes = attrs;
  126.       val_uid = Uid.internal_not_actually_unique; }
  127.    in
  128.    let sg = [Sig_value(id, vd, Exported)] in
  129.    let pat =
  130.      { pat_desc = Tpat_var(id, mknoloc name);
  131.        pat_loc = loc;
  132.        pat_extra = [];
  133.        pat_type = exp.exp_type;
  134.        pat_env = exp.exp_env;
  135.        pat_attributes = []; }
  136.    in
  137.    let vb =
  138.      { vb_pat = pat;
  139.        vb_expr = exp;
  140.        vb_attributes = attrs;
  141.        vb_loc = loc; }
  142.    in
  143.    let item =
  144.      { str_desc = Tstr_value(Nonrecursive, [vb]);
  145.        str_loc = loc;
  146.        str_env = exp.exp_env; }
  147.    in
  148.    let final_env = Env.add_value id vd exp.exp_env in
  149.    let str =
  150.      { str_items = [item];
  151.        str_type = sg;
  152.        str_final_env = final_env }
  153.    in
  154.    str, sg

  156. let execute_phrase print_outcome ppf phr =
  157.   match phr with
  158.   | Ptop_def sstr ->
  159.       let oldenv = !toplevel_env in
  160.       incr phrase_seqid;
  161.       let phrase_name = "TOP" ^ string_of_int !phrase_seqid in
  162.       Compilenv.reset ?packname:None phrase_name;
  163.       Typecore.reset_delayed_checks ();
  164.       let (str, sg, names, shape, newenv) =
  165.         Typemod.type_toplevel_phrase oldenv sstr
  166.       in
  167.       if !Clflags.dump_typedtree then Printtyped.implementation ppf str;
  168.       let sg' = Typemod.Signature_names.simplify newenv names sg in
  169.       ignore (Includemod.signatures oldenv ~mark:Mark_positive sg sg');
  170.       Typecore.force_delayed_checks ();
  171.       let shape = Shape.local_reduce shape in
  172.       if !Clflags.dump_shape then Shape.print ppf shape;
  173.       (* `let _ = <expression>` or even just `<expression>` require special
  174.          handling in toplevels, or nothing is displayed. In bytecode, the
  175.          lambda for <expression> is directly executed and the result _is_ the
  176.          value. In native, the lambda for <expression> is compiled and loaded
  177.          from a DLL, and the result of loading that DLL is _not_ the value
  178.          itself. In native, <expression> must therefore be named so that it can
  179.          be looked up after the DLL has been dlopen'd.

  181.          The expression is "named" after typing in order to ensure that both
  182.          bytecode and native toplevels always type-check _exactly_ the same
  183.          expression. Adding the binding at the parsetree level (before typing)
  184.          can create observable differences (e.g. in type variable names, see
  185.          tool-toplevel/topeval.ml in the testsuite) *)
  186.       let str, sg', rewritten =
  187.          match find_eval_phrase str with
  188.          | Some (e, attrs, loc) ->
  189.              let str, sg' = name_expression ~loc ~attrs e in
  190.              str, sg', true
  191.          | None -> str, sg', false
  192.       in
  193.       let module_ident, res, required_globals, size =
  194.         if Config.flambda then
  195.           let { Lambda.module_ident; main_module_block_size = size;
  196.                 required_globals; code = res } =
  197.             Translmod.transl_implementation_flambda phrase_name
  198.               (str, Tcoerce_none)
  199.           in
  200.           remember module_ident 0 sg';
  201.           module_ident, close_phrase res, required_globals, size
  202.         else
  203.           let size, res = Translmod.transl_store_phrases phrase_name str in
  204.           Ident.create_persistent phrase_name, res, Ident.Set.empty, size
  205.       in
  206.       Warnings.check_fatal ();
  207.       begin try
  208.         toplevel_env := newenv;
  209.         let res =
  210.           load_lambda ppf ~required_globals ~module_ident phrase_name res size
  211.         in
  212.         let out_phr =
  213.           match res with
  214.           | Result _ ->
  215.               if Config.flambda then
  216.                 (* CR-someday trefis: *)
  217.                 Env.register_import_as_opaque (Ident.name module_ident)
  218.               else
  219.                 Compilenv.record_global_approx_toplevel ();
  220.               if print_outcome then
  221.                 Printtyp.wrap_printing_env ~error:false oldenv (fun () ->
  222.                 match str.str_items with
  223.                 | [] -> Ophr_signature []
  224.                 | _ ->
  225.                     if rewritten then
  226.                       match sg' with
  227.                       | [ Sig_value (id, vd, _) ] ->
  228.                           let outv =
  229.                             outval_of_value newenv (toplevel_value id)
  230.                               vd.val_type
  231.                           in
  232.                           let ty = Printtyp.tree_of_type_scheme vd.val_type in
  233.                           Ophr_eval (outv, ty)
  234.                       | _ -> assert false
  235.                     else
  236.                       Ophr_signature (pr_item oldenv sg'))
  237.               else Ophr_signature []
  238.           | Exception exn ->
  239.               toplevel_env := oldenv;
  240.               if exn = Out_of_memory then Gc.full_major();
  241.               let outv =
  242.                 outval_of_value !toplevel_env (Obj.repr exn) Predef.type_exn
  243.               in
  244.               Ophr_exception (exn, outv)
  245.         in
  246.         begin match out_phr with
  247.         | Ophr_signature [] -> ()
  248.         | _ ->
  249.             Location.separate_new_message ppf;
  250.             !print_out_phrase ppf out_phr;
  251.         end;
  252.         begin match out_phr with
  253.         | Ophr_eval (_, _) | Ophr_signature _ -> true
  254.         | Ophr_exception _ -> false
  255.         end
  256.       with x ->
  257.         toplevel_env := oldenv; raise x
  258.       end
  259.   | Ptop_dir {pdir_name = {Location.txt = dir_name}; pdir_arg } ->
  260.       try_run_directive ppf dir_name pdir_arg


  263. (* API compat *)

  265. ‌let getvalue _ = assert false
  266. ‌let setvalue _ _ = assert false

  268. (* Loading files *)

  270. (* Load in-core a .cmxs file *)

  272. ‌let load_file _ (* fixme *) ppf name0 =
  273.   let name =
  274.     try Some (Load_path.find name0)
  275.     with Not_found -> None
  276.   in
  277.   match name with
  278.   | None -> fprintf ppf "File not found: %s@." name0; false
  279.   | Some name ->
  280.     let fn,tmp =
  281.       if Filename.check_suffix name ".cmx" || Filename.check_suffix name ".cmxa"
  282.       then
  283.         let cmxs = Filename.temp_file "caml" ".cmxs" in
  284.         Asmlink.link_shared ~ppf_dump:ppf [name] cmxs;
  285.         cmxs,true
  286.       else
  287.         name,false
  288.     in
  289. ‌    let success =
  290.       (* The Dynlink interface does not allow us to distinguish between
  291.           a Dynlink.Error exceptions raised in the loaded modules
  292.           or a genuine error during dynlink... *)
  293.       try Dynlink.loadfile fn; true
  294.       with
  295.       | Dynlink.Error err ->
  296.         fprintf ppf "Error while loading %s: %s.@."
  297.           name (Dynlink.error_message err);
  298.         false
  299.       | exn ->
  300.         print_exception_outcome ppf exn;
  301.         false
  302.     in
  303.     if tmp then (try Sys.remove fn with Sys_error _ -> ());
  304.     success

  306. ‌let init () =
  307.   Compmisc.init_path ();
  308.   Clflags.dlcode := true;
  309.   ()
